author: Elastic
description: Identifies remote execution via Windows Remote Management (WinRM) remote shell on a target host. This could be an indication of lateral movement.
false_positives: WinRM is a dual-use protocol that can be used for benign or malicious activity. It's important to baseline your environment to determine the amount of noise to expect from this tool.
name: Incoming Execution via WinRM Remote Shell
query:
sequence by host.id with maxspan=30s
   [network where process.pid == 4 and network.direction == "incoming" and
    destination.port in (5985, 5986) and network.protocol == "http" and not source.address in ("::1", "127.0.0.1")
   ]
   [process where event.type == "start" and process.parent.name : "winrshost.exe" and not process.name : "conhost.exe"]
